Here’s what’s at stake with Kavanaugh on the Court: the rights of women to make their own medical decisions; the rights of Americans to quality, affordable healthcare; civil rights; voting rights; the rights of workers to organize for better wages & working conditions; & more.

It is the very nature of our nation’s history that whatever gains we make won’t be permanent. It is incumbent upon every one of us to continue to fight for our future.

Representation matters.

If you are serious about this issue, tell your Republican pals in Congress to pass bills requiring Medicare to negotiate drug prices and enabling the importation of safe, low-cost drugs from Canada and other countries. (2/2)

Trump was clear during the campaign about his list of potential SCOTUS nominees: ALL want to take away a woman’s constitutional right to make her own health care decisions. We cannot go back to the days before Roe v. Wade.

RT @SenBooker Kavanaugh has written extensively on his beliefs that a sitting president shouldn't be subject to criminal investigations or civil lawsuits—this all but assures he would work to shield Trump from any litigation or criminal proceeding related to the special counsel's investigation

Senate Democrats, sadly, will try to demagogue this nomination, but they will not be successful. I am confident that the Senate will take up his nomination quickly & I expect that he will be confirmed before the first Monday in October, the beginning of the Supreme Court’s Term.

President Trump is currently a subject of an ongoing criminal investigation—there is a clear conflict of interest inherent in the President nominating someone who could be the deciding vote on a number of potential issues from that investigation that could come before the Court.

Brett Kavanaugh's record as a judge and lawyer is clear: hostile to health care for millions, opposed to the CFPB & corporate accountability, thinks Presidents like Trump are above the law – and conservatives are confident that he would overturn Roe v. Wade. I'll be voting no.

RT @SenBooker If Kavanaugh is confirmed, we could see progress rolled back on many issues including the right of women to make their own medical decisions, voting rights, rights of workers to organize for better wages & working conditions, the principle of equal justice under the law & more.

The fact that Kavanaugh believes that a President should not be subject to civil litigation or criminal investigation while in office means that Trump just nominated a justice who has already reached conclusions on these serious questions. That should raise enormous red flags.
Kavanaugh has a long track record of working to undermine the @EPA & laws that protect our environment from big polluters.

As a member of @senjudiciary, I look forward to his confirmation hearing, where Judge Kavanaugh will have the opportunity to demonstrate to the American people that he will uphold the rule of law and interpret the Constitution according to its original meaning. #SCOTUS

I stand in solidarity w/ Iranian women peacefully fighting for freedom in their country. The US and free world should do all we can to support these brave women who are risking their lives standing up to the regime. (2/2)

I know just how consequential this seat on the Supreme Court is. 

Had the Supreme Court not issued the unanimous opinion led by Chief Justice Earl Warren in Brown v. Board, I likely would not have become a lawyer and I certainly would not have become a U.S. Senator.

He has over 300 published opinions, with a strong record of defending the #SecondAmendment, safeguarding the separation of powers, reining in the unchecked power of federal agencies, and preserving our precious religious liberties.
